catalog-devel.name: catalog-devel

cgi-application.comments: CGI::Application builds upon the bedrock of CGI, adding a structure for writing truly reusable Web-applications. CGI::Application takes what works about CGI (using CGI.pm) and simply provides a structure to negate some of the more onerous programming techniques that have cast an unfavorable light upon it. See http://www.perl.com/pub/a/2001/06/05/cgi.html for more information.
cgi-application.name: CGI-Application
cgi-application.summary: For discussion of the use and development of the CGI::Application module, and related systems.  CGI::Application is a framework for building web-based applications in Perl.

dce-perl.name: dce-perl
dce-perl.sub: Send an email to mailto: majordomo@lists.csupomona.edu
dce-perl.summary: This mailing list is here for discussion, development and announcements related to the DCE-Perl modules. These modules use the Perl XS language (C in disguise), to make the DCE runtime functions available to Perl scripts. The Perl interface has been enhanced such that it takes advantage of Perl's namespace, data structures and Object-Oriented features.
dce-perl.unsub: Unsubscribe by sending an email to mailto: majordomo@lists.csupomona.edu

expectperl-announce.summary: This is a read-only, low-volume list for announcements of new releases of the Expect.pm perl module.

expectperl-discuss.name: expectperl-discuss
expectperl-discuss.summary: This list is a discussion forum for everything related to Expect.pm and its siblings IO::Tty and IO::Stty, including, but not limited to bug reports, feature requests, development discussion and question answering. If you only want to be kept informed about new releases, then the Expectperl-announce mailing list is for you.

finance-quote-devel.name: finance-quote-devel
